channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken glass spread across pavement, 8th March
item.description:
This stretch of pavement - from Sixways traffic lights to Highgrove - has a significant amount of sharp broken glass (clear and green glass; large to small pieces). Please can you arrange a sweep/clean to remove the danger from the high number of elderly & school-age pedestrians who walk this way due to the school and sheltered living at Home Farm Court, as well as dogs. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kidnappers Lane - Pothole, 8th March
item.description:
Pothole in road on Kidnappers Lane, heading away from Church Road, towards Leckhampton High School (approximately 150m from Nursery Rhymes Nursery). Pothole is deep and is filled with rainwater so almost hidden before drivers hit it and realisation of its depth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kidnappers Lane - Deep pothole in road, likely to be much deeper than tennis ball, 8th March
item.description:
Pothole in left of road next to kerb when heading away from Vineries Close towards Nursery Rhymes Nursery (just past the "Give Way" narrowing of the road). Depth of the pothole is more than a tennis ball, and depth of the kerb stone is exposed. Pothole is also hidden because it's filling with rain water meaning that drivers are unable to anticpate depth before it's too late.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 8th March
item.description:
email rec 29/02/2024 - Just wanted to say thank you for fixing the footpath! There is another area that suffer greatly and I wanted to bring it to your attention. It’s the section at the end of southcourt close. Apparently there is a drain at the bottom but it’s been blocked for years now and the whole path become a swap/river when it rains. I’ve attached a few photos for your reference.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on Glenfall Way causing vibration to house, 8th March
item.description:
There is a section of Glenfall Way close to Riverside Close that is breaking up into potholes. Although not extremely deep heavy vehicles hitting them cause a vibration to the walls of no 2 Reaburn Close. A skip hire company uses Glenfall Way for access to and from their premises so there is a higher than normal number of heavy vehicles using the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Glenfall Way, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken curb between no2 & 4 Reaburn Close, 8th March
item.description:
Part of the curb between no 2 & 4 Reaburn Close is broken (See photo). The pavements in Reaburn Close are in a generally poor state, in particular close to broken curb.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Reaburn Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep dinner plate size, 8th March
item.description:
There are about 4 large pot holes on the left hand side going up Birdlip Hill from GL3 4SN location to the Royal George. Vehicles are hitting the holes making the worse or moving into the centre of the road towards oncoming traffic. This is a dangerous situation especially at night and in wet weather conditions. I am very concerned from a road safety perspective.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 8th March
item.description:
Large frame where old sign was installed, the signs has been taken away but the frame is still there is causing obstruction to road users joining Leckhampton Rd. Please can these be taken away if not needed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains and mud filled gutter, 8th March
item.description:
2 drains blocked in Naunton Lane, at Thirlestain Rd end near White cross Square. Water has not drained away despite 4 consecutive dry days. Lots of rotting leaves turned to mulch in the gutter has compounded the problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Naunton Park Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter dropped on approach to roundabouts. Local drivers throwing rubbish from takeaways onto the verges as they slow down approaching roundabouts., 8th March
item.description:
Just by the side of the road - on the verge. Lots of litter. Needs cleaning up please. The local residents can't do it themselves because it is too dangerous for them. Please organise regular clean ups on the verges approaching the roundabouts around Gloucester. It is upsetting the local residents. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Interchange, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter dropped on the approach to the roundabout that needs to be picked up please, 8th March
item.description:
On approach to roundabout on left hand side - just as vehicles slow down. People throw rubbish out their windows when they are slowing down or stopping near the roundabout. I am happy to clean the rubbish myself but it is a bit too dangerous for me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): C&G Roundabout, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
